message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR 

The paper proposes a novel end-to-end trainable framework for person re-identification (ReID) using a dual attention mechanism. The proposed method involves learning context-aware feature sequences and performing attentive sequence comparison simultaneously. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves training the proposed network using a triplet loss assisted with a de-correlation loss and a cross-entropy loss, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also involves experiments on both image and video-based ReID benchmark datasets, which suggests that it may belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The paper involves the use of deep learning techniques for feature extraction and matching, which suggests that it may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of attention mechanisms for feature refinement and feature-pair alignment, which suggests that it may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category.
